response: "{ \"title\": \"[Hard] Inverse Factorial\", \"description\": \"The factorial of a non-negative integer n, denoted by n!, is the product of all positive integers less than or equal to n. Given an integer m, find the smallest non-negative integer n such that n! = m.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef inverse_factorial(m: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `m` (int): A positive integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the smallest non-negative integer `n` such that n! = m. If no such integer exists, return -1.\\n\", \"code\": \"\\ndef inverse_factorial(m: int) -> int:\\n    i, fact = 0, 1\\n    while True:\\n        if fact == m:\\n            return i\\n        elif fact > m:\\n            return -1\\n        i += 1\\n        fact *= i\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert inverse_factorial(6) == 3\", \"assert inverse_factorial(120) == 5\", \"assert inverse_factorial(720) == 6\", \"assert inverse_factorial(87178291200) == -1\"] }"
